title: Our HELOC was sold to Real Time Resolutions...can they collect or force foreclosure?
question: We live in California and filed Chapter 7 bankruptcy in 12/08. We included our 1st and HELOC, but have made payments untile recently. We are current on our 1st, but 2 months late on HELOC. We just received notification that they have reassigned, sold or transferred our HELOC to RTR...can they foreclose on the home
answers: A HELOC is a mortgage just like the 1st. The discharge eliminates your legal obligation to pay the debt, but it does not eliminate the bank's right to foreclose. When a mortgage (including a HELOC) is reassigned, sold or transferred, the new owner of the loan has the same rights as the original owner, which would include foreclosure. It would be a good idea to try to get caught up on the HELOC as soon as possible.

The lender's ONLY remedy is to foreclose since the underlying debt was discharged in your bankruptcy.

Sure, they can foreclose, a HELOC is just a 2nd mortgage or deed of trust. When you take out these loans, they are secured by your real estate. if you don't pay, they can file foreclosure proceedings.

Because of the current housing crisis, few lenders holding a second position will pursue foreclosure unless the balance you owe on your 1st mortgage is very small.

Why, because after going through the expense of foreclosure, they will have to pay your first mortgage until they can sell the property to some third party. And that can take time & cost them a lot of money.

Good luck!
